subject: p19075045
History: Mr. Is a M with PMH of ESRD recently initiated on HD, s/p bioprosthetic aortic valve replacement, CAD s/p 4v CABG, PPM for sick sinus syndrome, and s/p bilateral shoulder arthroplasties, who was admitted for MRSA bacteremia and is transferred to the CCU for hypotension during anesthesia induction. , pulmonary edema vs. PNA pulmonary edema vs. PNA.
Impression: Comparison to. No relevant change is seen. Low lung volumes. Stable correctly positioned monitoring and support devices. Moderate cardiomegaly with retrocardiac atelectasis. Minimal left pleural effusion. Mild fluid overload but no overt pulmonary edema.
